page.title: 12MEDIA A CHARITY APPEAL
page.content: A Northop woman is so impressed with the treatment she is receiving from Liverpool's Walton Hospital that she is organising a round of fund raising activities to buy medical equipment. Mrs. Pauline Wakley of Rhos y Chellis Farm broke her neck in a car accident twelve months ago. As a result she underwent a complicated operation at Walton's Neurosurgical Unit where bone was grafted from her hip to the damaged vertibrae.She said," While I was recovering I realised just how much the hospital was doing for Clwyd. Anyone from this area who suffers a severe head injury has to rely on Walton a tremendous amount".Mrs Wakley still has to wear a surgical collar but is hoping to get back to work on the farm when it is removed in August. At present she is organising an appeal for the hospital.
